author: Shawn McMurdo
title: ALLIN Social Betting Platform
description:
$200B betting industry lacks trust.

Sportsbooks control odds so they win.

Social media allows sharing experiences but not trusted betting.

assessments.note: I do have some misgivings about the potential abuse of users that might use such an Dapp. I cannot fault the potential for such a Dapp if the end product gains acceptance. The concept of P2P betting will eventually gain popularity and so the concept must be given due consideration.

Sports betting and gambling in general are huge industries through which large amounts of money flow. The interest in participation will help draw new users to the network and increase transaction volume generating more value. This DApp has great potential.
If done well it could be a powerful app. This is a crowded space and will not be easy to break into.

This idea is interesting because it intends to use social networks already consolidated, and as a result, promote sports betting, and use Cardano to create a smart contract that will manage the bets. I don't understand anything about sports betting, so I can't say with certainty that I think it's a safe idea, but starting from the assumption that this practice is common and frequent, I don't see why the increment with a financial system in blockshain would not bring more security and advantages, both for gamblers and for the community.

The problem and solution description is reasonable and the proposal is within the scope of this challenge.

The betting market is huge and has a flow of billions of dollars of capital, today that market is dominated by centralized companies, which allows corruption and market manipulation, which harms gamblers.

The goals and metrics described are subjective and do not allow assessing the potential impact of the proposal on this challenge.

Launching an app / website and growing the number of users are extremely subjective metrics. Any app launched will have 0 users and will increase its user base over time, the question is how much it will increase and whether this growth is considered to be impactful for the challenge. For this reason, it is essential to establish objective metrics and KPIs.

The proposal appears to have the experience to successfully develop the MVP although with a proposal of this type I would have liked to learn more about them. Who are they and what experience do they have within the betting industry?

The experience listed is relevant and the proposal is well organized, detailed, and reasonable. Development is already underway for this project, and there is a clearly defined timeline to set expectations and measure results against.

The proposer talks about betting platforms as setting the odds but doesn't mention the biggest centralised competitor this would have BetFair. What about Augur? How will it compete? What is the marketing strategy? How will it deal with regulations on betting?

In this part, it is said that the project is launched for a while with members from various countries, with different functions, such as developers, marketers and so on. Despite being a very solid, diverse and knowledge-rich base, apparently, it would also be beneficial to exemplify some works already done by the accomplished ones. On the attached website, there is a tab that talks about the group, but also does not provide names. I believe that it is always safer to know who the people are, to make the team more palpable, say.

The proposer is a participative and relatively well-known member of the Cardano community. He elaborated a CIP to modify the pledge curve and participates in the Plutus Pioneer Program, but I recommend that more information be presented so that we can evaluate his qualifications in an easy and transparent way.


The solution presented doesn't solve the problem, as there is no indication of how the proposal can scale or be efficient.

A smart contract between two or 3 people is quite different from a model for decentralizing bookmakers, the potential for impact is much less relevant.

Betting sites like Betfair have models where the bets are p2p, there is no entity defining the odds, but an agreement between two users and a fee that is paid to Betfair. There is still centralization in some aspects, but a concept that allows a more decentralized and fair model of price discovery (odds)

Letting a person set their own odds is a poor design choice and not user friendly, as it does not allow liquidity. it's like placing a sales order on an order book exchange and waiting for someone to fill that order.

Sellers want to charge a value above the ideal and buyers want to pay for a value below the ideal, how to make the odds of the bets approach and make the proposal viable?

Bookmakers resemble market makers and in the context of supply and demand design they reduce spreads and make the service viable.

My recommendation is that the proposer better describe how this proposal will scale and how it will generate liquidity so that the bets are combined.

The proposal has a serious dependence on a centralized oracle and this makes room for corruption and liveliness.

There is not enough information to judge the feasibility of the budget, as the proposal does not describe enough details to understand the work required to develop the project.

The concept and experience appears valid but the proposal lacks sufficient information to really shine. Having said that I feel that the proposal will develop over time whether funded or not as the proposal team further their own understanding of what such a Dapp requires to be sucessful.

In the proposal itself it's unclear how the DApp will generate revenue for itself to continue operations, considering there are no fees to use it and there is no "house" (all betting is fair and the betters set their own odds). However, the proposer's reply to a comment has indicated potential methods to generate revenue for the DApp creators to sustain operations. Although it would be nice to see this outlined in more detail within the proposal. Hence 4 out of 5 stars for feasibility.
More detail on competitive landscape and how this will compete to show it would be feasible to gain market share.

An action plan is drawn up, in relation to what would be done according to the time in months, as well as a division of costs. In general, we are provided with what we need to get a sense of how the project will go, however, I think that the part of the financial division could be more detailed. For example, in the $ 30,000 set aside for the development of the project, what would make up that development? As it is a large amount, it would be more interesting to clarify its use in more detail, in addition to dividing it into two large blocks.

There are not enough details on resource allocation. There are no metrics that indicate success and allow an efficient audit. There are no KPIs. Success goals are subjective and do not help with good auditability.

Although several relevant steps / implementations have been defined, there is no clear and understandable roadmap and this is essential to allow auditing.

solution: Create a decentralized social betting platform connecting people via social media & letting them set their own odds, eliminating the house.
